sentence.Network_en: He was a famous racketeer in Chicago.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是芝加哥有名的骗子.

sentence.Network_en: He was in no sense a political prisoner, but a gangster and racketeer who rightly did six years in jail.
sentence.Network_cn: 他绝不是一个政治犯, 而是一个歹徒和敲诈勒索犯,罪有应得地在监狱里蹲了6年.

sentence.Network_en: Al Capone was a famous racketeer in Chicago.
sentence.Network_cn: 艾勒·凯波尼是芝加哥有名的诈骗钱财的人.

entry.def: A racketeer is someone who makes money from illegal activities such as threatening people or selling worthless, immoral, or illegal goods or services.

means.word_mean: 1. some who commits crimes for profit (especially one who obtains money by fraud or extortion)
1. carry on illegal business activities involving crime
